b53c83bd-0b23-47cb-8abf-83404259d05b.description: Dismantling Racism introduces students to the research-based and field-tested terms, concepts, and principles to dismantle institutional racism. Students will complete the class with a familiarity with the language, historical orientation, and analytical framework for starting the work of dismantling racism in the institutions to which they belong. This is the first of three badges that will be earned in the course of getting the DEI micro-credential.
b53c83bd-0b23-47cb-8abf-83404259d05b.name: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: Dismantling Racism

badge_template_activities.title: Post three substantive, and thoughtful discussion board reflections and reply to six commentaries by fellow classmates.
Score an 8 out of 10 or better on three on-line quizzes covering the above content and assigned readings.

b012c965-5920-4156-b7ea-b189c0560961.description: The Inclusive Organization seeks to explore and develop our understanding of discrimination and marginalization in our business institutions in the United States, identify causes and practical solutions, and equip ourselves to be the change agents who implement diversity, equity, and inclusion in the organizations where we work. This is the third of three badges that will be earned in the course of getting the DEI micro-credential.
b012c965-5920-4156-b7ea-b189c0560961.name: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: The Inclusive Organization

badge_template_activities.title: Post five substantive and thoughtful discussion board reflections and reply to five commentaries by fellow classmates. Participants are also offered a Takeaway Assignment, which they can use to implement DEI programs at their organization.

Read posted articles, watch posted videos, and review Moodle materials for each topic: 1) Current State of DEI in Business, 2) Causes of the Current State, 3) Solutions - Organizational Policy Changes, and 4) Solutions- Organizational Culture Changes.
Course material applied at the student's own organization.

789dea3f-42b0-4871-9a4a-8b73978beeb7.description: Gender and Sexuality Through an Intersectional Lens explores the historical and contemporary concepts of gender and sexuality, and presents key theories of privilege, identity, and intersectionality (especially of race, class, gender, and sexuality) to prepare participants for effective implementation of diversity, equity, and inclusion in organizational contexts. This is the second of three badges that will be earned in the course of getting the DEI micro-credential.
789dea3f-42b0-4871-9a4a-8b73978beeb7.name: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: Gender and Sexuality Through an Intersectional Lens

badge_template_activities.title: Each week, post three (or more) substantive and thoughtful discussion board questions or reflections and reply to six (or more) of your classmates’ questions/reflections.
Score an 8 out of 10 or better on weekly quizzes included in the online lessons.

6ee11727-c013-4492-a65f-b0be710a80ee.description: This series of classes equips participants with the intellectual and practical resources they need to break down barriers and build up support mechanisms for long term anti-racist and anti-sexist work within their organizations. Students will complete the class with a familiarity with the language, historical orientation, and analytical framework for starting the work of dismantling racism and sexism in the institutions to which they belong.
6ee11727-c013-4492-a65f-b0be710a80ee.name: Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Micro-Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Passes three DEI mini courses: Dismantling Racism, Gender and Sexuality Through an Intersectional Lens, and The Inclusive Organization.
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: Dismantling Racism
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: Gender and Sexuality Through an Intersectional Lens
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: The Inclusive Organization
Completes all coursework for DEI mini courses

a932a034-3b47-489c-b858-7f90215cf515.description: Earners of the University of Montana (UM) Academic Advising Certificate have developed a fundamental understanding of: the historical and theoretical foundations of advising in American higher education; UM policies and procedures relevant to advising; technology tools available to UM advisors; support services and resources available to UM students; and various advising approaches and best practices.
a932a034-3b47-489c-b858-7f90215cf515.name: University of Montana Academic Advising Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete five foundational advising training courses and at least two specialized advising services training courses.

Proficiency in core advising competencies and relevant resources available through NACADA. Earners have also developed a foundation and framework for working with students from diverse backgrounds and experiences and have identified ways to make their advising practices more equitable and inclusive.

6ee0ef56-138f-48ff-8120-3f6d0f14cc85.description: The learning objectives within the JSR Micro-Credential serve as foundational skills for the entry level candidate to enter the construction industry or a trades career. The designation provides learners successful employability skills, worksite safety skills, and a solid foundation of construction skills. These learning outcomes have been identified and vetted through Industry Advisory Board participation and the Montana Statewide Construction Technology Curriculum Workforce.
6ee0ef56-138f-48ff-8120-3f6d0f14cc85.name: Job Site Ready

alignments.name: OSH 130 Industrial Safety and Certification course
alignments.description: The Job Site Ready Micro-Credential is built upon the curriculum of the existing OSH 130 Industrial Safety and Certification course that when taken for credit serves as the first foundational course towards all of the available CTS, CAS or AAS offerings within the Sustainable Construction Technology Program at Missoula College.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete traditional assessments measuring understanding of the construction industry, processes and techniques.
Complete OSHA approved written safety test.
Demonstrate safe operation of basic power tools.
Demonstrate practice of job-site safety.
Project participation and applied practice.

e36e5bc9-5a57-4e1f-8293-76f97a7bb4c5.description: This leadership and management program for University of Montana managers covers best practices in management- including both people management and management of units. The program includes six month-long units: Supporting Employee Success, Building Inclusive and Thriving Teams, Promoting Accountability and Effectiveness, Providing Feedback Through Coaching, Communicating with Your Team, and Recruiting and Retaining Employees.
e36e5bc9-5a57-4e1f-8293-76f97a7bb4c5.name: Practical Leadership Skills for Managers

badge_template_activities.title: To complete each unit, UM Managers must complete the online learning pathway, implement something from the online learning in their management, and attend an in-person/Zoom session that explores concepts in more depth. Completion of all six month-long units is required for the badge. Managers who earn this badge will have completed 10-20 hours of education on the various topics.

In addition to completing considerable online and in-person learning sessions, managers must implement something they learn from each topic in their own unit. Therefore, each area of learning is applied directly to their own work.

3ee3f093-a206-4d6a-8ff2-e49a2776221a.description: This badge demonstrates an understanding of how Culinary Medicine relates to Culinary Arts & Medical Sciences; how nutrition incorporates into the practice of Culinary Medicine; how to address the non-ingredient influences of dietary choices; epigenetics, nutrigenomics and other “-omic” approaches; the gut microbiome and how these relate to food choices and health. Moreover, recipients of this badge will gain a strategy to source tasteful and healthful comestibles.
3ee3f093-a206-4d6a-8ff2-e49a2776221a.name: Culinary Medicine Certification Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: This application requires agreement to all University of Montana on-line course and conduct requirements and policies.
Participants must receive a passing grade for the course to achieve badge.
Level 1 Certification in Culinary Medicine.
Participants pay University of Montana for on-line course.

skills.name: Understanding Cultural And Societal Influences On Diet Choices
Understanding Food Choices And Chronic Disease

0895d1fb-41d1-4691-9ee2-e493b289f482.description: Trained on the authorities and governing laws related to public health investigations in Montana, about COVID-19 and cases investigation processes in Montana, and how to respond during outbreak investigations. Trained in communicable disease modeling, the biology and genetics of pathogens, campus and community strategies for mitigation, testing, tracing and isolation/quarantine. Served the University of Montana; to educate and protect the campus community against infectious disease outbreaks.
0895d1fb-41d1-4691-9ee2-e493b289f482.name: Griz Health

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 4 asynchronous webinars
Attend a semester-long one hour weekly seminar

b4ad79f8-36a3-4e8b-8856-ae5989a681be.description: This badge demonstrates proficiency in authentic, strategic relationship development in order to build a powerful network and personal brand.
b4ad79f8-36a3-4e8b-8856-ae5989a681be.name: Professional Branding and Networking

badge_template_activities.title: Complete HONR 291 " Pursue Your Own Passion" course.

skills.name: Relationship Building Through In-person And Digital Human Connection

66ec0ffb-858c-490e-bfd7-0367d05ac735.description: Following the National Association of Colleges and Employers (NACE) competencies, this micro-credential will prepare learners to enter the workforce with appropriate employability skills that will navigate their ability to successfully apply for a job and perform in the workforce. These competencies include: Critical Thinking/Problem Solving, Oral/Written Communication, Teamwork/Collaboration, Digital Technology, Leadership, Professionalism, Career Management, and Global Fluency.
66ec0ffb-858c-490e-bfd7-0367d05ac735.name: Career Readiness

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of coursework, earning at least a grade of a B
Coursework is completed in a classroom and remotely. Self-study activities are also integrated using Moodle
Job fairs, mock interviewing, job shadowing
Digital portfolio of resume, cover letter, Linkedin profile, summary of strengths
Handshake registration
Participating in volunteer events in area of interest for career

665a23b1-b913-4088-bac6-011491372e69.description: Provides high school science teachers with professional development in how to offer a dual-credit Anatomy & Physiology course in their high school. The training will also cover information about the Next Generation Science Standards/Montana Science Standards and the National Health Science Standards so that the course can be standards-based. The teachers will develop a unit using Model-Based Inquiry curricula design, along with a unit evaluation tool that can be implemented in their A&P course.
665a23b1-b913-4088-bac6-011491372e69.name: Dual-Credit Anatomy and Physiology Training

badge_template_activities.title: Completed a self-paced, online training about offering a dual-credit anatomy & physiology course, which required discussion participation, reading of journal articles, and application of learning to the development of course materials
Participation in professional development experience
Development of model-based inquiry unit

skills.name: Implementation Of Best Science Teaching Practices

0a752961-85f3-4d4d-8fce-2906d75ef81d.description: The primary goal is to bring students enrolled in health care programs together to learn about inter-professional education (IPE) and collaborative practice concepts. They will develop skills to work as interdisciplinary teams in health care settings. Students will engage through online group discussions/activities, reading assignments and short topic presentations to develop core competencies for IPE and collaborative practice.
0a752961-85f3-4d4d-8fce-2906d75ef81d.name: Inter-Professional Practice Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Course quizzes and discussion posts
Completion of AHHS 450.50 "Interprofessional Collaborative Practice Skills" or AHHS 550.50 "Interprofessional Collaborative Practice Skills"
Course Tuition Paid
AHHS 450.50 and AHHS 550.50 conducted online

d9d0aaa6-7591-4ff0-bee8-93c873cfd55a.description: Earners of the Research Administration badge have a fundamental understanding of the management and operation of an Office of Research at a College or University. They will have the knowledge necessary to oversee sponsored programs, research compliance, federal relations, instrument COREs, centers and institutes, and negotiate and manage facilities and administration costs.
d9d0aaa6-7591-4ff0-bee8-93c873cfd55a.name: Research Administration

badge_template_activities.title: Passing a psuedo-job interview for Associate Vice President of Research position

7a485974-9a2f-4f95-9071-55ab25ef21af.description: Earners of the K-12 School Cybersecurity Certificate badge have fundamental understanding of national, state and school cybersecurity risk. Badge earners have the ability to incorporate application of cybersecurity policy, training, and protections into existing school protocol. Offered through the Montana Safe Schools Center, this asynchronous course on cybersecurity is applicable to K-12 school leaders, teachers, staff and IT professionals.
7a485974-9a2f-4f95-9071-55ab25ef21af.name: K-12 School Cybersecurity Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Submitting application form to access certificate course
Complete with a passing grade nine module quizzes
Complete all quizzes and modules
Students pay $25.00

skills.name: Ability To Include Cybersecurity Policy Into Existing School Protocol
Abitlity To Educate School Stakeholders On Cybersecurity Risks
Correct Application Of HIPAA And FERPA Guidlines For Student Privacy
Mitigating And Protecting A Cybersecurity Breach
Understanding Daily Needs For Network Monitoring
Understanding How Risk Assessment Is Conducted For Schools

8d5f5bb1-e007-4ae4-99f0-510badafc295.description: Earners of the Brewing Science badge have a fundamental understanding of the chemistry, biochemistry and microbiology underpinning the production of malted grains, fermentation, and packaging and distribution of brewed products. They will have knowledge of the origin and production of different styles of beer. They will be able to apply their knowledge to hobby home brewing and to the production of beer at the commercial scale.
8d5f5bb1-e007-4ae4-99f0-510badafc295.name: Brewing Science

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a 15-week, 60 hour course/webinar program
Two written exams with oral review

0e06b8fa-913d-4e69-a529-21e3f7348802.description: The Community Building Institute prepares early-career public professionals, and aspiring changemakers of all kinds, to address community needs in a responsible, equitable, and inclusive manner by centering the voices of community stakeholders. The focus areas of the series are community assessment, stakeholder engagement, advisory group formation, strategic planning and implementation, and program evaluation. The Community Building Institute is offered annually by Montana Campus Compact.
0e06b8fa-913d-4e69-a529-21e3f7348802.name: Community Building Institute

badge_template_activities.title: Badge recipients are assessed based on their engagement with the topics of the Community Building Cycle through brief reflective writing assignments.
Badge recipients will have participated in the six classes of the Community Building Institute.
Badge recipients will have paid a registration fee to attend the Community Building Institute, or they will have had that fee waived under certain circumstances.
Badge recipients will have registered to attend the Community Building Institute.

026a9fde-7ab0-4152-9fc9-2b816d57b2bc.description: Earners of the Community Integrated Health Care Specialist badge have a fundamental understanding of the challenges involved in delivering health care in an efficient and equitable manner. They offer preventive measures and provide follow up care to improve public health, and apply appropriate treatments within their Scope of Practice to ensure favorable outcomes for patients. They act as a vital link between patients and their primary care providers.
026a9fde-7ab0-4152-9fc9-2b816d57b2bc.name: Community Integrated Health Care

alignments.name: Endorsement
alignments.description: The Badge represents an additional endorsement for a Paramedic or EMT license.

badge_template_activities.title: Students must apply to the program.
Student must pass module tests.
Student must pass Community Integrated Health Care course.
Student must be a National Register EMT or Paramedic.
Student must complete didactic modules and filed internship.

skills.name: Patient Liaison With Primary Care Provider

774e5b21-800e-420a-8ef2-b0ca909955cb.description: Earners of the Health Professions Essentials badge have a fundamental understanding of the healthcare system along with basic knowledge of human anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology. They know the educational pathway of healthcare professionals from various healthcare career fields demonstrated by course participation and job shadowing experiences. These candidates can apply their understanding of human anatomy and how the human body functions to provide entry-level care to patients.
774e5b21-800e-420a-8ef2-b0ca909955cb.name: Health Professions Essentials

alignments.name: 1.1 Human Anatomy and Physiology
alignments.description: 1.1.2 Identify basic structures and describe functions of human body systems

alignments.name: 2.2 Medical Terminology
alignments.description: 2.2.1 Use common roots, prefixes, and suffixes to communicate information.

alignments.name: 4.3 Career Decision-making
alignments.description: 4.3.1 Research levels of education, credentialing requirements, and employment trends in health professions.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following courses with a minimum of a C- grade: AHMS 144 Medical Terminology, AHHS 191 Special Topics: Introductions to Health Professionals, BIOH 112 or BIOH 113 or BIOH 104/105
Complete Basic Life Support (BLS) CPR course, Pass accompanying BLS CPR examinations to receive certification
Complete 8 hours of health professions job shadowing in a healthcare facility

1f83b77f-3328-4a69-94f4-286cf56efba6.description: This micro-credential delivers a pathway for nonprofit professionals and students to advance their skills through leadership and development coursework in the areas of program planning and evaluation, board management, and fundraising. Additionally, earners must present a project at the annual Montana Nonprofit Association conference. This offering is a partnership between the University of Montana’s Department of Public Administration and Policy and the Montana Nonprofit Association.
1f83b77f-3328-4a69-94f4-286cf56efba6.name: Nonprofit Leadership and Development Credential

badge_template_activities.title: https://www.umt.edu/umonline/nonprofit-administration/default.php
Assessed by course instructors
BA/BS with 3.0 G.P.A. or higher to apply
$500 per class
Present project at annual Montana Nonprofit Association (MNA) conference
Earners are required to take the following courses: Program Planning and Evaluation (NPAD 503), Board Management (NPAD 506), Fundraising (NPAD 512)

1139e328-db76-432e-b85b-9886aefe08ad.description: Since the start of 2020, there has been an ongoing race to understand the COVID-19 virus and its impacts on our world. One of the most difficult factors has been explaining how human behavior impacts the pandemic. Psychological science has much to offer in understanding the interface between the virus and the societies in which we live. This course explores some of the key, lingering questions about the pandemic from psychological perspectives.
1139e328-db76-432e-b85b-9886aefe08ad.name: Psychology of the Pandemic

badge_template_activities.title: Students are required to complete a short assessment at the conclusion of each module/topic. Students must complete the assessment for all modules and earn an average score of at least 70% across the modules in order to be awarded the digital badge.
Psychology of the Pandemic (UM Online Course)

skills.name: Understanding Grief And Coping During A Pandemic
Understanding Parent And Kids During Pandemic

81e9222a-a219-4a73-a8ef-2670f30e4ce5.description: Overburdened K-12 public school professionals have scrambled to respond to the COVID-19 pandemic with little resources, knowledge, or support. This micro-credential will provide public schools with the foundational knowledge in public health policies and procedures and COVID-19 associated mitigation measures so that each school in Montana can operate as safely as possible and with the least disruption to student learning.
81e9222a-a219-4a73-a8ef-2670f30e4ce5.name: Public Health for School Based Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of 7 Online Modules: Module 1: Intro to Public Health; Module 2: Epidemiology; Module 3: Certified Contact Tracing Course; Module 4: Information Sharing: HIPPA & FERPA for Schools; Module 5: COVID Mitigation; Module 6: Communication; Module 7: Workplace Resilience in the Time of COVID
Completion of Certified Contact Tracing Training
